DOC.brief_summary: The intent propose randomize control trial test efficacy principle-based , transdiagnostic cognitive behavioral therapy ( CBT ) intervention address pathways minority stress compromise young gay bisexual men 's ( YGBM ) co-occurring mental ( e.g. , depression ) , behavioral ( e.g. , substance use ) , sexual ( e.g. , condomless anal sex ) health problem .
DOC.brief_title: A Unified Intervention Young Gay Bisexual Men 's Minority Stress , Mental Health , HIV Risk
DOC.detailed_description: ESTEEM ( Effective Skills Empower Effective Men ) 10-session skills-building intervention design reduce young gay bisexual men 's ( YGBM ) co-occurring health risk reduce underlying cognitive , affective , behavioral pathway minority stress impair YGBM 's health . ESTEEM base Unified Protocol , cognitive-behavioral therapy ( CBT ) approach efficacy across mental health risk behavior . In initial study create ESTEEM , Unified Protocol adapt conduct interview 21 YGBM-expert mental health provider 20 depress , anxious YGBM high risk HIV infection . In preliminary trial ( NCT02448186 ) , ESTEEM significantly reduce YGBM 's spectrum interrelate health threat , make first evidence-based intervention simultaneously improve mental health , substance use , sexual health outcome among YGBM . Important question remain order validate efficacy potential cost-effectiveness ESTEEM . Accordingly , propose 3-arm RCT would examine ( 1 ) whether ESTEEM ( arm 1 ) demonstrate significant improvement compare exist LGBT-affirmative community mental health treatment ( CMHT ; arm 2 ) standard HIV/STD voluntary counseling testing ( VCT ; arm 3 ) high-risk depress anxious YGBM ( 2 ) whether improves outcomes reduce hypothesize cognitive , affective , behavioral minority stress process .
